body:
I'm not sure about your docker-compose issues. I haven't done anything with extending or combining docker-compose configs. Maybe instead of trying to extend the normandy server config, making an independent Docker image? It could access Normandy via the API (with a link), but I'm not sure how you could use the Python imports. I think you could share the code via volumes as well.

As far as how to get files out of container, I think a good pattern is to mount a separate volume into the repo. That's how the monorepo's linter get the code to lint, and reports it's output.

I think running the actual s3 commands inside a container may be a good idea, so we don't have to set up the environment outside of Docker. Especially in the monorepo, this kind of system isolation is going to prove very useful.

It could access Normandy via the API (with a link), but I'm not sure how you could use the Python imports. I think you could share the code via volumes as well.

As far as how to get files out of container, I think a good pattern is to mount a separate volume into the repo. That's how the monorepo's linter get the code to lint, and reports it's output.
